Feat/native support
candidates.body:
This PR vastly improves the conversion of native/classic IDLs to anchor IDLs.

It also improves the `get_program_from_native_project` fn to only require a program name and to have the same optional args as `get_program_from_anchor_project`.

It includes some fixes for `process_instructions`, and template runbook generators for native programs.

Fixes #265

candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Expanded deployment capabilities with enhanced metadata for subgraph requests, including new fields for program ID and block height.
  - Added support for additional numeric types (u128, u256, i256) in value handling.
  - Introduced new structures and methods for improved event parsing and handling.

- **Refactor**
  - Streamlined request processing and event handling in subgraph deployments, including improved parameter management and error messaging.
  - Adjusted action template outputs for clearer and more concise messaging.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Release Notes

- **Configuration Updates**
  - Updated environment configuration values for relayer and authentication services.
  - Added new configuration placeholders for console and hosting services.

- **Dependency Management**
  - Updated workspace package version to 0.2.0.

  - Introduced `tokio` library version 1.43.0 for test utilities.

- **Event Handling Improvements**
  - Refactored action item event channels to use a broadcast mechanism.

candidates.title: feat: allow publishing and embedding runbooks
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

Based on the comprehensive summary, here are the updated release notes:

- **New Features**
	- Added support for embedded runbooks.
	- Enhanced addon management with namespace-based retrieval.
	- Introduced publishable runbook specifications.
	- Expanded command and input evaluation capabilities.
	- Added new subcommand for publishing runbooks.

- **Improvements**
	- Refined runtime and workspace context handling.
	- Improved serialization support for various structs.
	- Enhanced error diagnostics and input processing.
	- Streamlined addon registration mechanisms.

- **Examples**
	- Added new example configurations for EVM deployment scenarios.
	- Demonstrated embedded and embedding runbook patterns.

- **Infrastructure**
	- Updated GitHub workflow caching mechanism.
	- Migrated to a more functional addon retrieval approach.

These release notes capture the high-level changes without revealing implementation details.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
